designScenario.description: The Evacuation Control System is central to managing and executing emergency exits and route navigation protocols onboard passenger aircraft. Through an interconnected suite of automated mechanisms and sensors, this system ensures swift and orderly passenger evacuation during emergencies. It is designed to sustain operational reliability under stringent conditions and to interact seamlessly with related safety and control subsystems.
designScenario.name: Evacuation Control System

details.description: Using triggers from disaster detection units, the system should activate all emergency exit doors and illuminations.
Ensure compatibility with aircraft’s central processing architecture for signal reception.
Guarantee subsystems respond and execute within specified timeliness post-activation signal.
Enable clear and uninterrupted feedback communication during operations.
Employ cybersecurity measures against potential software-induced malfunctions resulting from external threats.
Reliability against misactivation caused by hardware retirement stresses.
Facilitate modular upgrades to system components for future-proofing.
Provide user-accessible diagnostic interfaces for routine checks and validations.

relationships.description: Central processing linking commands for execution between the central avionics module and evacuation unit.
The illumination signals connected ensuring guided and visual representations during egress operations.

systemComponents.description: Handles signal interpretation, dispatches instructions to execute evacuation orders.
systemComponents.name: Evacuation Activation Unit

subComponents.description: Illuminated feedback circuitry ensuring biometric-sensitive egress.
subComponents.name: Edge Illumination Controller

systemComponents.description: Guidance units providing passengers clear directional signals to closest exits based on calculated solvency paths.
systemComponents.name: Guidance Display Array

subComponents.description: LED boards communicating exact routing information.
subComponents.name: Exit Signal Boards

subComponents.description: Interactive modules updating egress plans on detected blockages.
subComponents.name: Dynamic Direction Controllers

comments.body: The Evacuation System ensures safety during emergencies by managing evacuation protocols.

rag_context: The Evacuation Control System is designed to manage safe evacuation protocols by integrating advanced door control mechanisms and directional guidance systems. It ensures rapid activation, operational reliability, and robust fail-safe measures. The system interfaces seamlessly with the central control unit and emergency lighting modules to promptly trigger evacuation signals during critical situations. The system has specific attributes such as response time of 3 seconds, operating temperature range of -20°C to 70°C, triple modular redundancy for fault tolerance, MTBF of 20000 hours, and dual power supply with battery backup for energy requirements. Additionally, it has requirements related to evacuation activation, response performance, fail-safe and redundancy, and interface and maintainability. The system components include managing safe evacuation protocols, automated door release mechanisms, and redundant sensor and actuator circuits for operational integrity.
